# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width::Int = 10)
    lines = []
    for word in split(text)
        if length(word) + length(lines) > text_width
            push!(lines, "\n")
        end
        push!(lines, word)
    end
    return join(lines)
end

# Example usage:
println(wrap_string("Hello world! This is a very long sentence that should wrap nicely."))
```

This function will output something like the following (depending on your terminal settings):

```plaintext
Hello world! This is a
very long sentence that should
wrap nicely.
```
